{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Inventory Officer",
  "description": "Tokiye Integrated Medical Service was created to address the critical needs in healthcare project management with an emphasis on effective and efficient service delivery. The company is driven by a passion for excellence and a commitment to professional service, aiming to elevate Nigeria&rsquo;s healthcare system to international standards.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Uyo, Akwa Ibom
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Inventory Officer will support the effective management, tracking, and control of all materials, equipment, and consumables on the project site.
	The role ensures accurate documentation, timely issuance of materials, and proper stock handling to support uninterrupted project execution. Working under the supervision of the head of procurement, the Inventory Officer will maintain inventory accuracy, transparency, and accountability across all site stores.


Key Responsibilities
Inventory Control and Recordkeeping:


	Receive, verify, and record all incoming materials and equipment against delivery notes and purchase orders.
	Maintain accurate inventory records for materials issued, transferred, and returned.
	Ensure all items are properly labeled, categorized, and stored in designated locations.
	Update inventory tracking systems or Excel-based records daily.


Material Issuance and Tracking:


	Issue materials to site teams strictly against approved requisitions.
	Track material movement from store to work fronts, ensuring full traceability.
	Monitor consumption rates and report abnormal usage or discrepancies.
	Support daily, weekly, and monthly stock counts and reconciliations.


Warehouse and Store Operations:


	Maintain orderly, safe, and clean storage areas in compliance with safety standards.
	Assist in loading and unloading of materials while preventing damage or loss.
	Ensure proper handling and storage of sensitive or high-value items.


Reporting and Coordination:


	Prepare daily inventory logs, material issue vouchers, and stock balance reports.
	Report low stock levels and slow-moving items to the Inventory Supervisor.
	Coordinate with procurement, logistics, and site engineers to ensure material availability.
	Support audit exercises and provide documentation as required.


Compliance and Accountability:


	Adhere strictly to company inventory procedures and internal controls.
	Maintain zero tolerance for undocumented material movement or losses.
	Ensure compliance with safety, quality, and audit requirements.


Qualifications


	HND, or Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, Accounting, or related field.
	Minimum 5 years of experience in inventory, warehouse, or store operations, preferably on construction or industrial projects.
	Familiarity with inventory management systems or Excel-based tracking tools.
	Strong numerical accuracy and recordkeeping skills.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and Applications to:&nbsp;hro.iih@tokiyemed.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2026-01-05",
  "validThrough": "2026-01-13",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Tokiye Integrated Medical Service"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",

       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Akwa ibom",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "192540"
  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Inventory Officer Job at Tokiye Integrated Medical Service




        
    

        
        Tokiye Integrated Medical Service was created to address the critical needs in healthcare project management with an emphasis on effective and efficient service delivery. The company is driven by a passion for excellence and a commitment to professional service, aiming to elevate Nigeria’s healthcare system to international standards.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Officer

Job Location: Uyo, Akwa Ibom
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Inventory Officer will support the effective management, tracking, and control of all materials, equipment, and consumables on the project site.
	The role ensures accurate documentation, timely issuance of materials, and proper stock handling to support uninterrupted project execution. Working under the supervision of the head of procurement, the Inventory Officer will maintain inventory accuracy, transparency, and accountability across all site stores.


Key Responsibilities
Inventory Control and Recordkeeping:


	Receive, verify, and record all incoming materials and equipment against delivery notes and purchase orders.
	Maintain accurate inventory records for materials issued, transferred, and returned.
	Ensure all items are properly labeled, categorized, and stored in designated locations.
	Update inventory tracking systems or Excel-based records daily.


Material Issuance and Tracking:


	Issue materials to site teams strictly against approved requisitions.
	Track material movement from store to work fronts, ensuring full traceability.
	Monitor consumption rates and report abnormal usage or discrepancies.
	Support daily, weekly, and monthly stock counts and reconciliations.


Warehouse and Store Operations:


	Maintain orderly, safe, and clean storage areas in compliance with safety standards.
	Assist in loading and unloading of materials while preventing damage or loss.
	Ensure proper handling and storage of sensitive or high-value items.


Reporting and Coordination:


	Prepare daily inventory logs, material issue vouchers, and stock balance reports.
	Report low stock levels and slow-moving items to the Inventory Supervisor.
	Coordinate with procurement, logistics, and site engineers to ensure material availability.
	Support audit exercises and provide documentation as required.


Compliance and Accountability:


	Adhere strictly to company inventory procedures and internal controls.
	Maintain zero tolerance for undocumented material movement or losses.
	Ensure compliance with safety, quality, and audit requirements.


Qualifications


	HND, or Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, Accounting, or related field.
	Minimum 5 years of experience in inventory, warehouse, or store operations, preferably on construction or industrial projects.
	Familiarity with inventory management systems or Excel-based tracking tools.
	Strong numerical accuracy and recordkeeping skills.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and Applications to: hro.iih@tokiyemed.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

Cashier Job at ESCA Sanitary




        
    

        
        ESCA Sanitary is a company that deals on sanitary wares, such as water closet, faucets, sinks, and other plumbing/building materials.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier

Job Location: Orile Iganmu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	The Cashier will be responsible for posting sales on the company's software, keeping records of payments and transaction. Should be computer literate, and smart.


Qualifications
     

            
    




	Interested candidates should possess an OND, HND, Bachelor's or Master's Degree with at least 1-31 year of experience.


Salary
N70,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: bonumcareers@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "General Manager, Sales",
  "description": "Worknigeria was established with a Singular Vision. To help the vast Nigerian workforce find meaningful jobs. We are also on a mission to upskill them in the best ways possible and help them grow with and within their careers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Manager, Sales

Job Location:&nbsp;Ogun
Work Schedule: Onsite
Industry: FMCG

Job Summary


	We are seeking a highly experienced and results-driven General Manager, Sales to lead and drive sales performance across FMCG operations.
	The ideal candidate will have deep expertise in the Food and Beverage manufacturing sector, with a strong track record of building high-performing sales teams, expanding market presence, and delivering sustainable revenue growth.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement comprehensive sales strategies to achieve revenue, volume, and market share targets
	Lead, mentor, and manage regional and national sales teams to drive high performance
	Identify new market opportunities, distribution channels, and strategic partnerships
	Build and maintain strong relationships with key distributors, wholesalers, and retail partners
	Collaborate with marketing, production, and supply chain teams to align sales forecasts with operational capacity
	Monitor sales performance, analyze market trends, and prepare regular reports for executive management
	Manage sales budgets, pricing strategies, and trade promotions to ensure profitability
	Ensure compliance with company policies and industry regulations


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field (MBA is an added advantage)
	Minimum of 10 years of progressive experience in sales leadership within the FMCG Sector
	Proven experience managing large sales teams and distributor networks
	Strong strategic, analytical, and negotiation skills
	Excellent leadership, communication, and relationship management abilities
	Willingness to be based in Ogun State


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to:&nbsp;careers@worknigeria.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the email subject.",
  "datePosted": "2026-01-05",
  "validThrough": "2026-01-19",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "worknigeria"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",

General Manager, Sales Job at Worknigeria




        
    

        
        Worknigeria was established with a Singular Vision. To help the vast Nigerian workforce find meaningful jobs. We are also on a mission to upskill them in the best ways possible and help them grow with and within their careers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Manager, Sales

Job Location: Ogun
Work Schedule: Onsite
Industry: FMCG

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a highly experienced and results-driven General Manager, Sales to lead and drive sales performance across FMCG operations.
	The ideal candidate will have deep expertise in the Food and Beverage manufacturing sector, with a strong track record of building high-performing sales teams, expanding market presence, and delivering sustainable revenue growth.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement comprehensive sales strategies to achieve revenue, volume, and market share targets
	Lead, mentor, and manage regional and national sales teams to drive high performance
	Identify new market opportunities, distribution channels, and strategic partnerships
	Build and maintain strong relationships with key distributors, wholesalers, and retail partners
	Collaborate with marketing, production, and supply chain teams to align sales forecasts with operational capacity
	Monitor sales performance, analyze market trends, and prepare regular reports for executive management
	Manage sales budgets, pricing strategies, and trade promotions to ensure profitability
	Ensure compliance with company policies and industry regulations


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field (MBA is an added advantage)
	Minimum of 10 years of progressive experience in sales leadership within the FMCG Sector
	Proven experience managing large sales teams and distributor networks
	Strong strategic, analytical, and negotiation skills
	Excellent leadership, communication, and relationship management abilities
	Willingness to be based in Ogun State


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: careers@worknigeria.com using the Job Position as the email subject.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "IT Expert (Software Development & Systems Support)",
  "description": "Redeemer&rsquo;s Health Village is committed to delivering excellent, patient-centered healthcare in a compassionate environment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Expert (Software Development &amp; Systems Support)

Job Location:&nbsp;Redemption City / Mowe, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Mode: On-site

About the Job


	We are seeking a highly skilled IT Expert with strong coding experience to join Redeemers Health Village Hospital on a full-time, on-site basis.
	This role is critical to supporting, developing, and maintaining our digital health systems, ensuring efficient, secure, and reliable technology operations across all hospital services.


Key Responsibilities


	Design, develop, test, and maintain software applications and internal systems
	Manage and support hospital IT infrastructure, including servers, networks, and databases
	Support, customize, and optimize Electronic Medical Records (EMR) and other health information systems
	Diagnose and resolve hardware, software, and network issues efficiently
	Implement data security measures, system backups, and ensure compliance with healthcare IT standards
	Collaborate with clinical and administrative teams to improve digital workflows
	Maintain accurate documentation of systems, processes, and technical procedures


Required Qualifications &amp; Skills


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related discipline
	Demonstrable coding experience (e.g., Python, Java, PHP, C#, JavaScript, or similar)
	Strong knowledge of databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, etc.)
	Solid understanding of system administration, networking, and cybersecurity
	Prior experience in a hospital or healthcare environment is an added advantage
	Strong analytical, troubleshooting, and communication skills
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a healthcare setting


What We Offer


	Opportunity to work in a reputable, mission-driven healthcare institution
	Supportive and professional work environment
	Competitive remuneration based on experience and qualifications
	Opportunity to contribute meaningfully to healthcare digital transformation


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV (and Portfolio, if applicable) to:&nbsp;careers@redeemershealthvillage.org&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

IT Expert (Software Development & Systems Support) Job at Redeemer’s Health Village




        
    

        
        Redeemer’s Health Village is committed to delivering excellent, patient-centered healthcare in a compassionate environment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Expert (Software Development & Systems Support)

Job Location: Redemption City / Mowe, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Mode: On-site

About the Job
     

            
    




	We are seeking a highly skilled IT Expert with strong coding experience to join Redeemers Health Village Hospital on a full-time, on-site basis.
	This role is critical to supporting, developing, and maintaining our digital health systems, ensuring efficient, secure, and reliable technology operations across all hospital services.


Key Responsibilities


	Design, develop, test, and maintain software applications and internal systems
	Manage and support hospital IT infrastructure, including servers, networks, and databases
	Support, customize, and optimize Electronic Medical Records (EMR) and other health information systems
	Diagnose and resolve hardware, software, and network issues efficiently
	Implement data security measures, system backups, and ensure compliance with healthcare IT standards
	Collaborate with clinical and administrative teams to improve digital workflows
	Maintain accurate documentation of systems, processes, and technical procedures


Required Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related discipline
	Demonstrable coding experience (e.g., Python, Java, PHP, C#, JavaScript, or similar)
	Strong knowledge of databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, etc.)
	Solid understanding of system administration, networking, and cybersecurity
	Prior experience in a hospital or healthcare environment is an added advantage
	Strong analytical, troubleshooting, and communication skills
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a healthcare setting


What We Offer


	Opportunity to work in a reputable, mission-driven healthcare institution
	Supportive and professional work environment
	Competitive remuneration based on experience and qualifications
	Opportunity to contribute meaningfully to healthcare digital transformation


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV (and Portfolio, if applicable) to: careers@redeemershealthvillage.org using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply
